events.name: NodeSchool
events.description:
NodeSchool is an open source project run by volunteers with two goals: to create high-quality programming curriculum and to host community web-tech learning events.

Join DevFest.Asia and DevFest.Asia attendees at this special edition Nodeschool hosted at Palo IT Singapore!

events.name: Rails Girls
events.description:
As part of DevFest.Asia 2016, come along and learn some Ruby on Rails from the Ruby Singapore group!

We love beginners so do join us if you are curious about web development and would like to find out more about Ruby and Ruby on Rails. As usual, we have a structured workshop session to guide you all along..
events.location: The HUB Singapore, 128 Prinsep Street, Singapore undefined

events.name: Everything about Data Analytics Bootcamp 5-Part Series
events.description:
Our Everything About Analytics Bootcamp is coming back! Amidst an increasingly competitive business landscape in an increasingly data-driven world, companies across various industries are making data analytics a top priority to stay ahead of the competition. Hence, it comes as no surprise that data analysis has become one of the hottest skills with demand outstripping supply. Register for our Data Analytics Bootcamp and learn how to analyse datasets through hands on experience with powerful tools such as Excel, Tableau, SQL and R within 5 sessions. 


Book your tickets for the Bootcamp here: http://peatix.com/event/210748 Links to individual session ticket (You are strongly recommended to buy series tickets): Session 1 Excel (S$50) :cg-excel.peatix.com Session 2 Data Visualization ($50):cg-dv.peatix.com Session 3 Statistics with R (Part1 ($50)): cg-r1.peatix.com Session 3 Statistics with R (Part2) ($50): cg-r2.peatix.com Session 4 Data Warehouse ($50): cg-dw.peatix.com Session 5 Students Final Presentation Visitor Tickets (Free) - cg-final.peatix.com The Bootcamp will be conducted by industry experts who will impart knowledge on how to apply these skills can be applied in the real world. Learn how to ask the right questions about data, derive insights using data and perform basic exploration of large complex datasets. At the end of the course, you will gain an understanding of how insights from data can help you make strategic decisions confidently. The Bootcamp will culminate with a final project where all participants will apply what they have learnt and present their findings in the final 6th session of the Data Analytics Bootcamp. Outstanding presentations will be published on CodingGirls official website, slideshare platforms and promoted through various social media channels. Syllabus: Session 01 - Data in Excel (Nov 6th, 2016, 1:30pm - 5:00pm) Introduction to Data Analytics Excel basics: Workbook structure, formulae, inbuilt functions (eg. Pivot Tables) Basic VBA Project: Simple inventory management for CRUD and basic analytics requirements  Session 02 - Data Visualization (Nov 13th, 2016, 1:30 pm - 5:00 pm) Learn how to create stunning data visualization examples with Tableau. Intro of data visulizationShowcase of good&bad data visualizationHands-on: create a storyboard in Tableau Session 03 - Statistics with R (Nov 20th, 2016, 10am-5pm) Part 1: (10 am - 12:30 pm) Introduction to R (installation of R and RStudio) Basic R syntax/grammar (for, if, while, which, write, read etc…) Basic R statistics function (mean, min, max, as.numeric, data.frame etc…) Basic R visualisation function (plot, hist, barplot, etc…) Advanced R visualisation (grid, ggplot) Hands-on practice Part 2: (1:30 - 5:00 pm) Basic statistics Regression Models Data Cleaning R hands-on Session 04 - Data Warehouse (Nov 27th, 2016, 1:30pm - 5:00 pm) Introduction to DBMS Setting up and installing MySQL Relational DB and ER diagrams Structured Query Language Hands-on Exercise Session 05 - Final Presentation & Graduation (Dec 4th, 2016, 1:30 pm - 5:00 pm) Add to calendar: https://calendar.google.com/calendar/embed?src=codingirls.org_g8744rsa27lbg0qjv7h8ctos88%40group.calendar.google.com&ctz=Asia/Singapore Cancellation Policy Plans change. We get it. But if you can't make it to a class/workshop, please email us at least 5 days before the scheduled event date. No refunds will be given after this timeframe. CodingGirls is a Singapore-registered NGO, which aims to empower more girls to code to achieve their ambitions in tech world. All revenue will be used to cover the cost of each project. We provide hands-on workshops, tech sharing talks and female leaders talk. Both men and women are welcomed ! Check out our website (www.codingirls.org) and follow our FB for more info: CodingGirls SG. Or you may send email to: [masked]
events.location: IDA Labs Level 3 @ National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, #03-04, 188969, Singapore
